title: Bybit's Yoyee Wang Says Capital-Efficient Custody and Regulatory Clarity Are Key to Institutional Crypto Adoption
description: **media[876752]**ABU DHABI, UAE, Dec. 22, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Bybit, the world's second-largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, participated in the HSC Asset Management high-level conference in Abu Dhabi, where Yoyee Wang, Head of Business-to-Business (BBU), highlighted the role of custody design, capital efficiency and regulatory clarity in institutional engagement with digital assets. The two-day event brought together policymakers, asset managers and technology leaders to discuss global investment trends, digital assets, artificial intelligence and the future architecture of financial markets.
content: ABU DHABI, UAE, Dec. 22, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Bybit, the world's second-largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, participated in the HSC Asset Management high-level conference in Abu Dhabi, where Yoyee Wang, Head of Business-to-Business (BB... [4827 chars]

title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - UAE Emerges as Global Leader in AI and Digital Infrastructure
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. Its impact is far-reaching, transforming industries, reshaping economies, and influencing the way we navigate daily life.

title: New study finds AI chatbots can influence some Canadians to change their vote
description: Talking with an AI chatbot can successfully convince people to change their votes and could affect the outcome of future elections, according to a newly published study. However, Canada has few, if any, rules to govern how artificial intelligence is used in future elections.
content:
Talking with an AI chatbot can successfully convince people to change their votes and could affect the outcome of future elections, according to a new study.

description: In 2025, job losses attributed to artificial intelligence surpassed 50,000 in the US technology sector, highlighting the swift impact of automation on employment. , Industry, Times Now
content:
